Manx: Ta’n gollan gheayee er hyndaa thie,
Diplomatic: Ta’n gollan gheayee er hindaa thie

Manx: Ta’n niarragh aalin er jeet reesht,
English: The beautiful Spring has come back,
Diplomatic: Ta’n niarragh aalin er jeet reesht

Manx: Ta’n chooag er jeet reesht gys Crook,
English: The cuckoo has come back to Crook(haven),
Diplomatic: Ta’n chooag er jeet reesht gys crook

English: And crows as she always did.

Manx: As ayns yn cheyll t’ee gra ‘cook cook’,
English: And in the forest she says ‘cook cook’,
Diplomatic: As ayns yn cheyll t’ee gra cook cook

Manx: As shynnee farkiagh myr v’ad keayrt,
English: And foxes waiting as they were once,
Diplomatic: As shynnee farkiagh mor v’ad cheayrt

Manx: Biljyn ny keylley lane dy chiaull,
English: Trees of the forest full of music,
Diplomatic: Biljyn ny keylley lane dy chiaul

Manx: Da Jee ta reill dy chooilley voayl,
English: To God who rules every place,
Diplomatic: Da Jee ta reill dy chooilley voayl
